intro: Oreocarya elata, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its small, white or pale pink flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oreocarya elata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions of California and Nevada.
